summary: Email exchange between an FBI Victim Services Division Program Manager and an Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York regarding the attendance of attorney Spencer Kuvin at meetings in Florida and New York related to the Epstein case. The FBI confirms Kuvin was not present at either meeting.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: Attorney who has been providing quotes to the media about meetings in Florida and New York related to the Epstein case, but who is confirmed not to have attended those meetings.

persons.name: Amanda
persons.role: Program Manager, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: FBI official who responds to confirm that Spencer Kuvin was not at the meetings in Florida or New York, after checking with another individual (VS).

connections.description: Colleagues or professional contacts communicating about case details, with M seeking confirmation from Amanda (FBI) about attorney attendance.
Amanda consulted VS to verify attendance information about the meetings.
M is investigating Kuvin's potential involvement or claims regarding the Epstein case meetings.

events.title: Email inquiry about attorney attendance
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney M emails FBI's Amanda to confirm whether attorney Spencer Kuvin attended meetings in Florida and New York related to the Epstein case, following up on Kuvin's media quotes.

events.title: Meetings in Florida and New York
events.description: Previously held meetings in Florida and New York related to the Epstein case, attendance at which is being verified.

keyFacts: Attorney Spencer Kuvin was providing quotes to the media about Epstein case meetings he did not attend, according to FBI confirmation.
The FBI Victim Services Division and the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York were coordinating to verify attendance at case-related meetings.
The email exchange demonstrates ongoing investigation and media management efforts in the Epstein case as of October 2019.
